Description: Wall and ring foot sherd of Attic pottery squat lekythos; interior reserved; exterior: on wall, net pattern in black glaze with added white dots on interstices; on foot, dots of black glaze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Piekarski gives the following comparanda: Robinson, Olynthus XIII (1950) 160-166, especially p. 164, no. 171 pl. 107; Venit 1988 111, 133 no. 393-395 pl. 82 Also published by C. Bulas, BCH 56 (1932) 290 no. 22 and in CVA Bonn (1) 48. See also Haspels, ABL, 167-8 note 3.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p.43 no. C 27 pl. 17.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1961)
